intro: Eschweilera longirachis, commonly known as the long-armed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are typically broad and palmately lobed, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Eschweilera longirachis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
